p:
In this system of ordinary differential equations,
λ
is the force or hazard rate of infection,
ε
is the rate of disease progression (its reciprocal is the latent period),
γ
is the rate of recovery (its reciprocal is the infectious period), p is the proportion surviving (thus, disease-induced mortality is 1 – p), a is the contact rate (contacts per person per time period),
β
is the probability of infection on contact between a susceptible and an infectious person, and N is the total population size.
